replacement) OR total knee arthroplasty). This meta-analysis
collected data from published articles and thus no ethic approval
2. Interventions: The intervention group received the combined
ACB and LIA for pain control after TKA.
3. Comparisons: The control group received LIA alone for pain
4. Outcomes: visual analogue scale (VAS) with rest or mobili-
zation at 8 h, 24 h and 48 h, total morphine consumption at 6
h, 24 h and 48 h, distance walked at 24 h and 48 h and the
5. Study design: RCTs were regarded as eligible in the study.
Non-RCTs, letters, editorial comments and combined ACB
with LIA with other comparison were excluded in this meta-
Articles would be excluded from the present meta-analysis for
case reports, conference abstract or review articles. Two
owchart for the included studies. PRISMA
preferred reporting items for systematic reviews and meta-analyses.
